DOC.brief_summary: This research study phase III double arm , multicenter , randomize control clinical trial compare endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography ( ERCP ) stenting plus photodynamic therapy ( PDT ) versus ERCP stenting alone adult patient unresectable cholangiocarcinoma . The study objective investigate efficacy photodynamic therapy ( PDT ) increase survival time patient unresectable cholangiocarcinoma ass effect PDT cholestasis health-related quality life ( HRQoL ) .

DOC.criteria: Patient age 18 year old Patient diagnose nonresectable cholangiocarcinoma , determine CT within 30 day enrollment CT show Bismuth Tumor Stage : IIIa , IIIb , IV ( Bismuth tumor stage I II eligible participate ) Patients must adequate organ marrow function define : Patient 's INR ≤ 2 within 30 day treatment Patient 's platelet > 50,000/cmm within 30 day treatment Patient 's Absolute Neutrophil Count ( ANC ) > 1,500/cmm within 30 day treatment Patient 's creatinine ≤ 3 mg/dL within 30 day treatment Patient ability understand willingness comply study procedure provide write informed consent participate study Patient diagnose cholangiocarcinoma 3 month ago Patient metastatic disease Patient acute porphyria Subjects exhibit neurologic cutaneous symptom undergo urinary deltaaminolevulinic acid porphobilinogen dosage test determine severity . Patient pregnant ( Women child bear age must negative pregnancy test prior registration must agree use adequate contraception study therapy ) Patient concurrent non solid malignancy
